revised_title: The Hydrolysis of Methylic Acetate by Acids: A Study of the Processes Operative in Solutions
tldr: The author investigates the hydrolysis of methylic acetate by acids and discovers that the rate of hydrolysis is not proportional to the concentration of the acid. The study also reveals that water does not play a direct role in the change, acting only as a solvent. The results provide insight into the complex nature of chemical reactions and the factors influencing their rates.
